name: Sheraton Indianapolis City Centre Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed one night and overall had a great stay.
reviews.title: Worth Staying Here

likes.liked: — Great location and quality of room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros ---
reviews.title: Great Stay in Downtown Indy

likes.disliked: — Pool was stark with no shade

reviews.text: Great location and within walking distance to all major attractions including Lucas Oil Stadium.
reviews.title: Nothing but Trouble

likes.disliked: — the insutling attitude of the asociate who checked me in

reviews.text: Room was very nicely appointed -- appears to have been recently renovated. Comfortable bed, nice work desk, and flat screen TV.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: Room had a great view of the city lights and Monument Circle! Ask for a room on the 9th floor or higher and for this view.
reviews.title: Expensive, Poorly Maintained and Lacking in Knowledge

reviews.text: I was in town for a convention and found the Sheraton to be an excellent location at a reasonable price. Rooms were clean and quiet, with access to many amenities. The staff, more than anything else, really made my stay a memorable one. They were courteous and responsive to every single request. Linda, who worked in the clubhouse, was a rare talent. Her unmatched commitment to customer service is a compliment to the hotel and the entire Starwood association.
reviews.title: Excellent and Professional Staff

reviews.text: We stayed at the Sheraton for our Gen Con convention due to its location.
reviews.title: Gencon Trip
Expensive but great location
reviews.text: The room was nice and clean, the bed was fine. We paid the extra money to be able to go to the club room. It had snacks, breakfast items, and most evenings wine and cheese. We stopped at the club room most afternoons to relax and play a game or two at the tables. They had yummy brownies and cookies in the evening for us to enjoy. My only complaint was the $25 dollar a day charge for parking. It was an added expense I was not expecting. When I asked the front desk person about the charge she was very snippy about it, and said all the hotels charged for parking. I have traveled to Indianapolis for business trips frequently, and I can say that not every hotel charged me for parking. The pool also was looking a little dated, it needed a face lift. Overall a good experience, the club room had yummy food, and a nice person working there, and the room was clean and comfortable. The staff at check in could have been nicer, and I was surprised by the $25 dollar daily fee.

reviews.title: Wedding Weekend
reviews.text: We stayed here for the Kenny Chesney concert because of its proximity to Lucas Oil Stadium. Parking was expensive but average from what I've seen and check in was easy. The room was clean, beds were comfortable, and the hotel was very close to everything. Overall a good experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Last September I began working with The Sheraton in preparation for my son's wedding. Although the rooms were a little dated, location to the church and reception were perfect. After seeing The Panorama Ballroom on the 21st Floor, we decided to hold the rehearsal dinner there. The food, service, and view of downtown Indy were fabulous- our guests raved about the event. (Thanks, Jamie!). Since all of our guests were coming from out of town, the Parlor Room was recommended. With 2 attached rooms, this oversized area with small kitchen, tables, and big screen TV was a perfect meeting place for our friends and family. (Thanks, Brett!)
reviews.title: Concert Weekend Getaway

reviews.text: I stayed here for a weekend for my wedding (we stayed with family here and got ready and did our pictures downtown, and had the wedding on the south side of Indy). It's a nice hotel, but pricey. Parking is $23 self-park, $25 for valet daily to begin with. We got the room for $80/night on Hotwire, but the regular rates are over $200. The rooms are pretty tiny with standard sized bathrooms. The beds are comfortable. The rooms are either way hot or way cold as usual. The view was pretty cool though. The service was nice until we left and had problems with random charges on our room, then the ladies on the phone were gruff and mean. The location is awesome and within walking distance of nearly everything - very cool staying right on the circle. My family from the boonies of Michigan seemed impressed. It was clean and nice, but very pricey for everything from internet to the crappy buffet breakfast ($12 for hard eggs). And $5 bottled water in the room. Lovely! Starbucks is in the lobby though which was nice.
reviews.title: Not worth full price.

reviews.text: Overall, it worked out great for our needs and the price we got, but I wouldn't stay at this hotel again since it's way overpriced for what you get, and the service we got while trying to fix charges on the phone was less than helpful. I would recommend it to people ONLY if they booked through a site like Hotwire and got a deal, and wanted a downtown experience. Otherwise, the Holiday Inn Express offered the same kind of amenities and more exceptional service for less.
reviews.title: Nice renovation. Too bad the AC doesn't work.

reviews.text: I am sitting in my room sweating as I type this. It's warm outside and the AC in my room has been cranking full blast since I arrived to no avail. It's blowing out room temperture air, about 75 degrees, I'd say, even though I have it set to 50, now, in an attempt to cool it off in here. Room service overcharged me. The menu said 99 cents for a soda. They charged me $3, quite a difference. The front desk had my reservation screwed up. I had booked a special rate where your second night is equal to your birth year. The clerk couldn't figure out how to do it. The rooms are tiny, too. The front desk clerk barely spoke to me, even though I was the only guest checking in for miles. She could have at least smiled or acknowledged my existence. Ahhhhhhhh!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Good location, nice hotel

reviews.text: Good amenities, rooms are great, sleep number bed also is a huge plus. Lobby and restaurant are pleasing and food and drinks are well within walking distance
reviews.title: Almost a perfect stay... but a lot went wrong!

reviews.text: Upon arrival one of the two rooms we booked was not ready, even though we arrived late for check in. The personnel were very friendly and accommodating in view of this. When we went up to the room it was very well cleaned, so we were pleased. We called to request a refrigerator and one came within 10 minutes. Every need we had, and in view of it being a busy weekend because of the basketball tournament, they met speedily. That evening however when going up to our room, myself and my cousin had the elevator break down with us in it! We had to wait an hour and a half for maintenance to arrive and open the doors. The second mishap was the fact that we had neighbors that thought we talked to loud. Keep in mind, there was no party, no music, in fact we didn't even watch TV! They called the front desk and had someone come knock on our door, then they proceeded to bang on our wall, then lastly they slipped a nasty note under our door. It really put a damper on our socializing.
reviews.title: Very accommodating

reviews.text: To start, I am a travel agent and have stayed at numerous hotels (I was not traveling as an agent this time). This was a great hotel by comparison. Not luxury but very nice. We were traveling for a cheerleader competition so the close proximity to the convention center is our reasoning for choosing this property however it was a little further than I thought (about 6 blocks-they told us 2). The rooms were clean and crisp with modern furniture. Bathrooms were updated and worked great. The air conditioning was not the greatest but was good enough. The view was amazing and we didn't even have the monument view which would have been even better. We had connecting rooms (a king corner room and a room with 2 double beds) which were requested and delivered as promised. One of the rooms was not ready upon check in (even though it was late) but that wasn't a big deal. I thought the service was great. People were friendly and very helpful. There always seemed to be several staff members around to help with directions, information or anything else you might need. Parking was great and convenient though a little expensive. The hallways were a little dated. The wallpaper was peeling a little but since I didn't sleep there I didn't care. The 9th floor pool was a little dissapointing. However this is one of the few downtown hotels that has an outdoor pool. Like many other reviews I agree it was little more than a pool amoung a vast concrete roof with a few lounge chairs. The view from there was amazing though. It overlooked the monument. There is a lot of potential there and I think they could make the pool area great. The location of the hotel was perfect. We walked everywhere. There was so much to see and do in the area. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Loved our stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for a wedding and were sorely disappointed. The hotel's carpets were dirty. The wallks dingy. The rooms themselves were fine, but the common areas were just gross. The elevators were super slow. The pool was packed. The location is excellent for any downtown activities, but the amenties are really lacking. I'd stay somewhere else the next time.
reviews.title: Great location, OLD hotel

reviews.text: We stayed for a weekend at this hotel and were sorely disappointed in a number of things we encountered. The walls are very thin, paint was chipping in the hallway and on our door, the shower head was broken and sprayed all over the bathroom, the elevators took 10-15 minutes every time we wanted to go downstairs, the pool looks nothing like the pictures on the website, the staff seemed annoyed with any requests we made and our complimentary water bottle had already been opened and drank from when we got there. Great location, but we'll never stay here or recommend this hotel again.
reviews.title: Stay somewhere else...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Layout -
reviews.title: July 4th Stay, good FDM

reviews.text: To start things off I formerly worked at the “newest greatest” hotel that is a full-service hotel in Indianapolis (Take a guess which hotel that is). I no longer work there, so I am not biased at all. If anything I am a tough critic. Right off the bat one thing I liked about their design was how the parking garage was on the second, third, and fourth floor. This is very clever, because there will be better views for the guest rooms. The rooms were updated probably three to five years ago; they had an HD TV and average furniture.
reviews.title: Awesome location but...

reviews.text: Stayed here on SPG points for the Big Ten Tournament. Hotel staff was top notch! We had two suites that were right next to each other. Check-in was a breeze and the hotel was packed. TV's in one room didn't work, placed a call to the front desk within 5 minutes maintenance was up there and had the tv's running. Another time we needed more towels, called and they were promptly delivered. Needed a bellman for luggage - readily available. I cannot say enough about the staff at this hotel. They were extremely efficient and very friendly.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location, walking distance to the capitol, bar area, city centre mall. Expect to pay for parking. Nice front desk staff and well appointed guest rooms, updated and clean. Flat screen TVs in both rooms of the suite.
reviews.title: Solid property for a city stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I decided to have an evening get-away downtown a few weeks before Christmas. We had dinner plans that night at Ruth Chris and went to the Colts game the next day. The stay at the Sheraton was fantastic. Clean rooms, nice amenities, and the view from our room was awesome. We overlooked monument circle out our window. And around Christmas time, it was like having a Christmas tree right outside our window. Staff were very courteous and took care of our every need. The breakfast buffet in the lobby was good and the Starbucks also in the lobby was great. There was some construction going on in the lobby, but they kept it so quiet and covered, it was hard to notice. I would recommend for any business traveler or a couple that's just looking to get away for a night.
reviews.title: Great location, very comfortable stay, great view

likes.disliked: — Parking garage was a little difficult to navigate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to say I had higher expectations, but was satisfied overall. This was our first stay at a Sheraton, we always stay with Marriott. I chose this hotel because of the special rate and the pet policy. They allow pets under 40lbs free! We like to travel with our dog, but usually don’t due to the pet cleaning fee charged by most hotels. The room was nice enough, we were on the “Starwood Preferred Guest Level” which was nice. The floor we were on was VERY warm. I would not usually complain about this, but it was almost unbearable. The room was that warm too, we didn’t even have our heat on. The valet was EXCELLENT. Never been treated better.
reviews.title: Nice

reviews.text: I've just come back from a weeks stay at this hotel and it was wonderful. I was in town for a conference and was unable to stay in the conference hotel but this was just round the corner.
reviews.title: Wonderful

likes.liked: — Location, service and view from my window

reviews.title: They gave our guaranteed room away!
reviews.text: We tries to check in prior to 3pm and there weren't any rooms ready. We were told our room was guaranteed all night and we could check in late. When we tried to check in, they had given our room away and sent us to the Weston. At the Weston they first room didn't even have a bed! And the second one wasnt clean, there were dirty towels int he floor and the beds had been slept in! RIDICULOUS!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel during the Indy 500 week so it was busy and buzzing. As a city centre hotel, it does its job - it's convenient for shopping, restaurants and other facilities and it has parking facilities (which cost extra). The staff are welcoming and very helpful but if there was a complaint, it is just that the hotel is a bit tired and could do with a refurbishment. It did not detract from our stay, but it is something that needs to be addressed before too long.
reviews.title: Slightly tired but well located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here on a short, but nice, weekend away. The location was excellent. We did not drive the whole weekend, choosing to walk to multiple restaurants, parks, and other attractions nearby. The bath was a little on the small side, but nice. Our only complaint was thatour room was only two away from the elevators, which were VERY noisy.
reviews.title: Nice weekend away

reviews.text: We were required to stay at this hotel by our group, who booked a BLOCK of rooms to keep us all together during the trip. I even confirmed when booking that the rooms were in the same location of the hotel. However, upon arrival, we learned that our group had been spread all over the hotel across floors 14-20. This was not only not what was requested, but it created an inconvenience to other guests who were now being put in between our rooms (which were filled with cheerleaders). There reasoning was the computer randomly assigns rooms on checkin. So instead of doing the manual logistics and putting us all on one floor, so our group was the only one disturbed (and as requested), they chose to seperate us and have issues on ALL floors from other guests being disturbed.
reviews.title: Disappointed, Too Expensive for the Value

reviews.text: In addition to this oversight, this is an older hotel with less amenities, but since it is downtown, they choose to charge the same as the newer hotels for stays. So, for the price of $110 per night (group rate), I was expecting much more. I have had better stays at Super 8 and the Days Inn we stayed at afterwards was far superior at half the price. Even on a top floor, the street noise was still an issue here with a large bus stop right outside. There is also construction on the top floor for a new fitness room that shakes the whole building from 9am-5pm. The pillows were great but the bed was too hard and the comforter was great but would not stay on the bed. No breakfast included and parking is $25 per night. The pool is very small for this type of hotel and outdoors so not usable in bad weather, and no sauna/spa. Room service is overpriced and the business center is located in the middle of the bar with kids running in and out of the area screaming and playing. Housekeeping is the worst...our trash was never emptied and after I left it right in front of the maid in the hallway she still did not take it. They also left food boxes and beer bottles sitting on the hallway settees for days.
reviews.title: Awful Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is located right in the city center with great views of the war memorial and just a few blocks from the City Center Mall - the perfect location for travelers without a rental car. Unlike other Sheratons, this Sheraton charges for in-room internet access, but wi-fi is free in the hotel lobby and there's a Starbuck located in the hotel lobby with free wi-fi.
reviews.title: Great Location & Excellent Value

reviews.text: As a basic SPG (frequent user/customer), I was greeted with a bag of goodies (bottle of water and a couple of sweet treats) upon check-in.
reviews.title: Top Notch Hotel

reviews.text: Rooms are nice and big with all the amenities. Rates are very reasonable and a great value.
reviews.title: mean people

reviews.text: I must say this is one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in!!! We stayed here for a Friend's Birthday and enjoyed a relaxing time. The pool area is breathtaking, it overlooks the city. The room had the look of a luxury hotel, without paying the high price!!!
reviews.title: Pretty Average

reviews.text: I highly recommend this hotel over any other in the Indianapolis area. It is centrally located next to all the bars and entertainment!!!
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

reviews.text: For the last several years I've been a loyal Hilton customer but decided it was time to try other hotels and their rewards programs. I opted to start with Starwood. This was my first stay at a non-HIlton hotel in Indianapolis where I visit regularly for business. Usually I stay at the Downtown HGI. The rooms at this Sheraton are a little dated but clean. I loved that they provided Starbucks coffee in the room and my own personal loofah. The bed comfort was a little better than the HGI but the HGI's room was more updated. The hallways needed some updating too. One part of the Sheraton's hallway had plywood on it. I'm not sure why. The workout room at the Sheraton offers much more than the HGI. I also loved the Sherton's in room dining options. My breakfast was delicious and timely. I did not like that anyone can access the elevators to the hotel rooms from the parking garage except from 10pm-6am. As a solo female traveler that makes me uncomfortable.
reviews.title: Good for Business Trips

reviews.text: We stayed here for a Jackson Browne concert the front desk helped us pick a bar close to the murant theater and they helped out with all our side trips with great advice . Rooms were clean and beds were really comfortable. Would return again the Hotel is just off of the Indy circle in the heart of downtown Indy. Great stay thanks to all.
reviews.title: on the circle

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel during a heavy traffic weekend, and while for the most part my experience was acceptable there was a huge problem that persisted and even managed to get worse throughout our stay. During our stay the heavy use had damaged a few of the elevators, and while this was understandable it only got worse. On the floor we were staying at the down elevator button did not respond, leaving us only able to hit up and wait for an open elevator and then ride it up until we could begin to descend to the main floor. This was a inconvenience for everyone, ourselves and the people who were on the floors above us actually trying to get to a higher floor since we occupied space on an elevator and wanted to go the opposite direction. We decided to just take the stairwell to save ourselves time and embarassment. When we arrived at the stairwell there was a sign that simply stated to leave the door closed at all times, and assuming that it simply meant not to leave the door open behind us we entered the stairwell. By the time we got to the third floor the stairwell did not have working lights, and as we made our way to the 2nd we realized the doors did not open from the inside. We walked down the dark stairwell to the bottom floor and ran into a door with a fire alarm. We went all the way back up to the 8th floor checking every door only to find outselves locked in. We looked for a phone to call the front desk but the only one we found was knocked off the wall and laying in peices on the floor. We finally descended again and left out the fire alarm door, which did not sound. When we talked to people at the desk we got a simple and dry 'you aren't supposed to use the stairs, if you do you have to walk to the bottom floor and use that door' when we asked why there was nothing telling us this they didn't have a response. Apperently this problem persisted for many others because later in the day they unlocked all the floors so you could use the stairs, and they made it a point to inform everyone of this. After using the stairs without issues for the next 6 hours we suddenly found ourselves locked out of the 8th floor yet again, and had to walk all the way back to the first floor once more. When we asked yet again why we were locked out we were told someone must have locked the doors and that while it was a mistake it wasn't likely anyone would unlock the doors again. This sort of thing can ruin any trip, and the absolute lack of concern on the staff's part really left a sour taste in our mouths. While I've heard they're working to replace the broken elevators I haven't heard anything apologizing for the complete lack of concern with the problem. I will not return if I can help it.
reviews.title: Disconcerned staff

reviews.text: Great hotel, all staff very accommodating. Went to the Moto GP, bike show was right outside the hotel. Too many tractors (Harleys) muscling in for a sport bike weekend but that isn't the hotel's fault. The best was Linda working in the clubhouse. She went out of her way to make us feel at home. I forgot what it was like having mom look after me!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Linda's Clubhouse Rocks

reviews.text: All very good except parking should come with the room, its a bit pricey at $25.00 a night. Just bring your motor bike, it'll make it around the wig wag no problem.
reviews.title: Seriously Outstanding!

description: The Sheraton Indianapolis City Centre Hotel offers a warm welcome in the heart of beautiful downtown Indianapolis.
